item.title: u.s. returns smuggled peruvian artifacts
item.description: an 18th century manuscript, pottery dating back to a.d. 300 and other smuggled artifacts were returned to peru by u.s. customs officials on thursday at the peruvian embassy.

item.title: braves 4, mets 0; braves 4, mets 2: stay in atlanta costs mets two games and a pitcher
item.description: the mets dropped a doubleheader in atlanta and placed chris young, one of their best pitchers this season, on the disabled list.

item.title: sports of the times: again, a star is prosecuted for his unlikability
item.description: like an imprisoned boxing champion of a century ago, barry bonds is a black athlete whose brazen behavior enraged many.

item.title: at one post office, tax day is a reason to dance and sing
item.description: every year, on tax day, residents of lawrence, kan., gather in the lobby of a local post office for a circus-like celebration as procrastinators rush to mail off their tax returns.

item.title: at least 38 dead after boat sinks in congo
item.description: at least 38 people died in the democratic republic of congo when the boat they were traveling in capsized on monday, the red cross said.

item.title: hollywood publicist gene shefrin dead at 90
item.description: former hollywood publicist gene shefrin, who represented don rickles, guy lombardo and dick clark during a career spanning 42 years, has died after a battle with parkinson's disease. he was 90.

item.title: shania twain to resume career with vegas residency
item.description: country star shania twain will end her self-imposed career hiatus by starting a two-year residency in las vegas in december 2012, she said wednesday.

item.title: n.f.l. players put faith in lawyer's bold move
item.description: as the players' suit against the n.f.l. begins wednesday with court arguments, they will be represented by jeffrey kessler, one of the most prominent and provocative lawyers in sports.

item.title: violence rises as israel and hamas trade blows
item.description: israeli aircraft and artillery continued to strike gaza on saturday, killing three more militants, including a hamas senior commander.

item.title: with teeth and goals, burrows gets under bruins' skin
item.description: after avoiding a suspension for biting a bruin's fingers in game 1, alexandre burrows scored twice in game 2, ending the game in overtime and giving vancouver a 2-0 lead in the stanley cup finals.

item.title: turkish troops kill 7 kurdish rebels in clash
item.description: turkish security forces killed seven kurdish guerrillas in an army operation in eastern turkey, military sources told reuters thursday.

item.title: siemens wants nsn to grab market share
item.description: siemens will push its struggling telecom gear venture nokia siemens networks to win market share, siemens' finance director said on thursday.

item.title: nebraska couple create photo exhibits of u.s. war dead
item.description: a traveling photo exhibit of 98 u.s. military from nebraska and western iowa killed in the afghanistan and iraq wars has inspired its creators to put together similar displays across the country.

item.title: sony pictures confirms hacking of its websites
item.description: sony pictures entertainment confirmed late friday evening that some of its websites were breached and it was working with the federal bureau of investigation to identify the attackers.

item.title: rebounding woes dog heat in loss to bulls
item.description: the miami heat do not need a fortuneteller to predict their agenda at practice the next two days.

item.title: sarah ferguson: royal wedding snub 'so difficult'
item.description: while her nephew prince william is off honeymooning -- reportedly in seychelles -- sarah ferguson is still smarting from her royal diss.

item.title: japan nuclear plant could leak more radioactive water
item.description: the operator of the stricken japanese nuclear power plant said on friday that more radioactive water could begin spilling into the sea later this month if there is a glitch in setting up a new decontamination system.

item.title: film of cosmic chaos, end of earth wows cannes
item.description: a cosmic collision brings the end to all life in "melancholia," a grand cinematic vision from danish maverick director lars von trier that had the cannes film festival buzzing with excitement on wednesday.

item.title: u.s. auto engineer in chinese custody for over a year
item.description: the engineer, who won awards for his work developing catalysts that control auto emissions, is being held on charges of violating trade secrets, according to u.s. officials.

item.title: baked goods may improve milk allergy symptoms
item.description: eating baked goods that contain milk may help children get over milk allergies, a new study suggests.

item.title: special report: china set to unearth shale power
item.description: china has spent tens of billions of dollars buying into energy resources from africa to latin america to slake the unquenched thirst for fuel from its growing industry and burgeoning cities.

item.title: at war: embedistan: unembedded vs. embedded
item.description: for many journalists, embedding has become an integral part of reporting in afghanistan, but the military is only a piece of the story.

item.title: e3 2011: nintendo unveils new console with touch-screen controller
item.description: with its new console, nintendo is looking to open a new window on video games.

item.title: did farming push us to war?
item.description: agricultural wealth was more subject to looting and may have spurred early farmers to invest in arms.

item.title: brotherhood: u.s. troops should now quit iraq, afghan
item.description: egypt's muslim brotherhood said on monday that u.s. soldiers should be withdrawn from afghanistan and iraq after the killing of osama bin laden, the mastermind of the september 11 attacks that led to two u.s.-led wars.

item.title: accounting chief wants higher bank capital ratios
item.description: new bank capital rules should be about 30 percent higher than agreed, to prevent a repeat of the last financial crisis, the incoming head of the world's biggest accounting standard setter said on sunday.

item.title: westminster abbey royal wedding app released
item.description: mobile-phone users across the globe will be able to take a virtual walk up the aisle of westminster abbey ahead of prince william and kate middleton's wedding.

item.title: how did six taliban hold off 100 security forces for 16 hours?
item.description: a pakistani navy commando was the first to detect taliban militants attacking a naval aviation base in the city of karachi on sunday night. he was dead within seconds.

item.title: news analysis: with ivory coast crippled by sanctions, a leader still holds on
item.description: president laurent gbagbo, widely regarded as having lost last year's election, has nonetheless managed to maintain power, in part by taking over the lucrative trade in cocoa.

item.title: u.n. nuclear agency inspects syria's homs site
item.description: the u.n. atomic watchdog carried out an agreed inspection of a syrian plant on friday as part of a long-stalled probe into suspected covert nuclear activity.

item.title: "thor" set for thunderous debut at box office
item.description: foreign box office champ "thor" finally lands in north american theaters on friday, hoping to spawn another superhero franchise for marvel studios.

item.description: the n.f.l. labor talks are the equivalent of watching hot dogs being made, and then having to witness joey chestnut and takeru kobayashi trying to eat as many of them as they can in 10 minutes.
